sentences.english: He says if you could stand on the Moon and watch the total lunar eclipse, the view would be even more dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 如果能在月亮上看月全食，場景會更令人驚奇。

sentences.english: Remarkably, the total lunar eclipse coincided with the date of the December Solstice.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，這次月全食恰好發生在冬至日。

sentences.english: The first total lunar eclipse will occurs on June 16, 2011, Bejing time.
sentences.chinese: 今年第一次月全食將發生在北京時間16日凌晨。

sentences.english: Then when was the last time that we had a total lunar eclipse occur on the same date as the winter solstice?
sentences.chinese: 那麼上一次人類在冬至時節看到月全食是什麼時候呢？

sentences.english: Millions of people gazed skywards this morning to see the first total lunar eclipse for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 今晨，上萬民衆注視天空，觀看近三年來首次月全食。

sentences.english: The sun was rising out of the east and the moon was at full eclipse on the west.
sentences.chinese: 太陽正從東方升起，月亮在西方處於月全食期。

sentences.english: Total eclipse of the Moon in 2007 (AP)Skywatchers around the world are gearing up to observe a rare total lunar eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 全世界的天文愛好者都在準備着觀察罕見的月全食。

sentences.english: Meteor Shower and Total Lunar Eclipse to Wow Skywatchers This Month.
sentences.chinese: 本月公衆可賞流星雨和月全食。

definition: an annular eclipse of the sun

pinyin: lie4 hu4 zuo4 liu2 xing1 yu3
